text.p: These are the leading stories in the Egyptian press on Friday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- All political parties wholeheartedly welcome the "21st Century Egypt" document which reflects President Hosni Mubarak's vision for the future and the projects that will take Egypt into the next century.
- World Bank delegation to visit Cairo mid-month to discuss the New Valley project. International Monetary Fund approves the revised version of the economic reform programme.
- Public Enterprise Minister Atef Obeid will head a commercial delegation including 65 businessmen to the United Arab Emirates and Qatar.
- Presidential adviser Osama el-Baz tells Reuters Television that the chances for the success of the U.S. initiative hinge on freezing settlement activities in Jerusalem.
- Turkish President Suleyman Demirel to visit Egypt this month to sign cooperation and partnership agreements.
- Clinton may ask Netanyahu to stop settlements for six months! Israeli plans to build thousands of settlements in the West Bank.
- For the Eid al-Adha festival: 35,000 sheep and 6,000 cows arrive from Australia.
- Prime Minister Kamal Ganzouri says the government is keen to support the democratic process.
- Ganzouri says the government is able to pay for the infrastructure of the New Valley project.
- Egyptian delegation will travel to Washington to promote the international tender to prospect for oil in 155,000 square metres of land in the New Valley, Siwa oasis and Aswan.
